reviews.review_msg: Wasn't the prof for this class, but learned more in the hour tutorial once a week than in all the lectures (3) in a week combined. Excellent at communicating material and is highly personable. I took 326 with her as the prof, and was was not the slightest bit disappointed with either. Fantastic job, fantastic instructor.

Was excited to see she was teaching this after taking KIN110 and acing it 5 years ago. Her lectures are great. Follow her notes, do all her practice questions, and go to all tutorials and she will give you all the info to ace her class, and learn the concepts.

This was the most horrible class I've ever taken. If you enjoy memorizing pointless details rather than understanding big picture concepts, this course is for you! This beats calc as the worst 8:30am (or any) class I've ever had to take. Booo

Great notes - she posts them on webct before class and also adds hand written notes. A lot to memorize in this course, especially all the diagrams. She also supplies great study questions. Would recommend her. Not the most interesting instructor, but she got the job done in a clear and concise manner. She's very personable - easy to approach w/Q's.
clear notes, but expect to memorize diagrams

She'll give you a zero if you give your answers on point form, prefers pargraphs. Also she'll take marks off if you write too much. I agree, very anal and unapproachable. She favors students who does well in her class but very few students do. However, he does manage to squeeze in a review session before the midterm and final.
Very anal marker.  I found her very unapproachable and unwelcoming. I really did not enjoy her class.
VERY VERY picky prof. she gives great lectures but the way she marks her exams is way too anal. Getting a good grade for her class is way too much work.

Dr. Cupples is more than fair. Students are very biased towards him for some reason. He helped me whenever I asked for help and I got an A. Easy A if you ask me considering the fact that I didn't even attend most lectures. He's a really nice guy.
Not sure what the fuss is about. Clear prof, and decent lectures!

Some love him, some hate him. I understand both. Notes need a lot of work and the mark allocation on the first midterm made me want to cry. I couldn't follow his lectures, but listening to him after on tape, he comes across as very knowledgable and clear. Could be one of the best profs in kin but needs to put aside stubbornness & make some changes
easy A. Good Prof very helpful if you asked for help.

He clearly should NOT be a professor.  He has interest in renal physiology and yet no interest in displaying his knowledge in a manor in which to aid students in learning the material.  He admittedly says he is allowed to be the big mean teacher and conveys an ego which could not possibly entice any student to want to learn from him.
Worst prof that ever stepped foot in SFU.  I'm serious.

Very nice guy but it doesn't make up for his lack of organization and knowledge given that this is a core course for all other upper level classes. Knew a lot about renal physiology but had no clue in other areas of physiology, especially neurophysiology. I love physiology but Dr. Cupples really ruined the class. Also, he has no grading scheme.
Do the study questions and you'll be ok. Nice guy, ppt slides can be somewhat confusing at times

One of the worst professors I have had so far at SFU. Besides Renal Physiology, he has absolutely no clue what he is talking about. He says "I don't know" at least 10 times per class if a question is asked. He has not interest in the welfare of the students and clearly shouldn't be teaching. He marks really anally so look out!!!
